question: A current of 3 A is passed through a molten calcium salt for 1 hr 47 min 13 sec. The mass of calcium deposited is: (Molar mass of <katex>$Ca=40gmol^{-1}$</katex> [cite: 332-334]
explanation: Time = <katex>$3600 + 47(60) + 13 = 6433$</katex> s. Q = It = <katex>$3 \times 6433 = 19299$</katex> C. Moles electrons = 19299/96500 = 0.2. Ca requires 2e. Moles Ca = 0.1. Mass = <katex>$0.1 \times 40 = 4.0$</katex> g. [cite: 337, 339]
